name: Early Christian Art and Architecture
description: Examines art and architecture during the emergence of Christianity in the West until ca. 600, focusing primarily on Italy. Assesses the connections between polytheistic, imperial Roman art and new Christian traditions in a variety of media, including mosaics, metalwork, wall painting, and sculpture. Also considers the role of primary texts in the interpretation of Early Christian art. [24S]
prerequisites: FAH101H5/FAH202H5 and FAH215H5 or FAH216H5 or P.I.
